question: What are the two basin countries of "Jubba River"?
explanation: Ethiopia and Somalia are the two basin countries of the Jubba River. This river rises at the confluence of the Dawa River and Ganale Dorya River in Ethiopia and flows south to reach Somalia, which finally drains at the Somali Sea. This river flows through the Jubaland, a Federal member state in southern Somalia. The Jubba basin region is the richest part of the country because of its fertile farmland.
